title: Brilliant practice
body: I’ve seen a range of GPs, nurses and health care assistants at this practice and have been really happy with my care 99% of the time. I’ve always been able to get an emergency appt when required and I feel listened to and understood by the staff. Have not had any issues with reception staff either.

title: denying my experience
body:
I've got restless legs 24 hrs a day, enough to make me feel suicidal with it.  I got a worker today saying that I haven't got restless legs.  Even though my mum phoned crisis and said that my restless legs is worse than it was before.  

I know what I'm experiencing, whereas a worker will see you for a minute and decide for themselves what is happening and you are forced not to have your own opinion.

title: Awful Doctors
body:
I have been with this surgery for only a few weeks and have already decided to go to a different one. 

I tried to explain that the medication I am currently on is making me feel suicidal and that it isn’t safe for me to be on it. The doctor i spoke to was unsympathetic and frankly, quite rude about the situation. Claiming that it wasn’t something he would be dealing with. And that I’d be better off talking to the mental health team. I told him that GP’s have been in charge of prescribing my medication for mental health for over 10 years. When I asked him to explain why he didn’t want to help get me off of medication that is making me suicidal, he refused to answer the question. Then said
“I can do a referral to the mental health team if you want.” 

In a tone that would suggest he didn’t care about the outcome.
I do not understand why he refused to help me and why he would be so unsympathetic towards a patient that has opened up about being suicidal.  

There is a patient information leaflet that comes with medication stating that if your symptoms worsen, or if you are suffering from suicidal thoughts, contact your GP. Yet when i did exactly what i was instructed to do, i was refused help. And what's worse, he didn't bother to even say/spell my name correctly and has openly told me he didn't have my notes in front of him during our appointment on the telephone.

author: ksw23
title: Information and handling of vaccines
body:
RE: Information and handling of vaccines for non paid carers of shielders who are shielding with them  
I am a chronically ill person of 30 years and I care for both my mother and my sister. Since all three of us are high risk (even though my gp has not put me on the shielding list) we have been in full shielding since the beginning of March. My mother has had her first jab at home and at the time I asked the gp what would be happening for my sister and myself. I was told they didn't know as it would not be them dealing with it. However this turned out to be incorrect as they have just been to give my sister her first jab.  
I again asked both on the phone and in person why I could not get my first jab at the same time and instead of trying to help me or understand why I am fighting to get protected as soon as possible (I can't get to the clinic as I am not well enough and on top of that if I get sick there is no one else to look after my family, they would both end up in state care and our dogs in a rescue centre, the worry that most non paid carers have had to deal with this past year is not just about trying to keep our loved ones safe but to keep ourselves safe because if we get sick there is more often than not no one else to look after them but no one in the health service seems to understand this), instead they just told me the same line 'we are following government guidelines and you aren't on the list'.  
I phoned the health board and got the number for the vaccine booking line who were far more thoughtful and understanding than my gp practice has been and they have put me on the list to get a home visit from the district nurse, but they can't tell me how long it will take. The fact that people who are not trained doctors or health professionals showed me more understanding and consideration than my own gp practice has is shocking, I am perfectly ware they are working hard, but they are not the only ones who have been having a stressful time.  
I have seen no consideration for non paid carers or even the attempt to understand what we have been going through or why we are desperate to get as protected as possible as soon as possible. It makes me feel uncared for, unimportant and disposable and I shouldn't feel any of those things when dealing with my gp practice in any way let alone during a pandemic.

readBy.name: Office of Colin Smyth, MSP for South Scotland

author: CAMMY
title: Wheelchair assessment
body:
On my assessment I was told that I would get a motorised wheelchair that was way back in Dec 2020  
Is there any progress on the situation as of now ?

author: Hezz
title: Waiting Lists
body: I have been on the waiting list to see a consultant since Dec 2018. My local MLA has even tried to help but to no avail. I had to give up my employment as I was so restricted with my arm. I just wish we could sort the waiting times out as I know I’m not alone. It’s very sad considering the dedication of those who work in the health service.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: piscescx24
title: Being delayed an appointment due to sons age
body:
Just after my son had turned one we started having concerns about his development - he was not meeting milestones as expected and seemed to be 'behind' (mentally rather than physically). He was not pointing and had a regression in regards to giving any eye contact or answering to his name which were the first signs we wondered if something was wrong.  
We expressed our concerns to our Health Visitor who came to see our son and mentioned we think our son could be autistic. She was great at reviewing our son but agreed he 'failed' most of the assessments that she tried on him on a few separate visits (I think the only one that didn't come back concerning was the gross motor skills section) and said that she shared our concerns in thinking he is possibly autistic. He was seen by a GP who said she also thought it was likely he could be autistic.  
He was referred to SALT and OT who also share our concerns. He is non verbal at almost 2 years old and has a lot of sensory issues. He was referred to the pediatrician after his 1st birthday which unfortunately was declined at first by them mainly due to his age and I think taking a 'wait and see' approach having not have seen the SALT team etc for long enough. We felt very disappointed and deflated at this as the professionals listed above had all shared our concerns. We tried to push to still be on the waiting list as I knew this would be around a year long anyway. Disappointingly they asked that we re refer him when he was 18 months again.  
When he turned 18 months we still had the same concerns if not more but the referral was accepted this time however we were told he would not be seen until he was 2.5yo (September 2021). Although we are happy his referral has now been accepted we are disappointed at how long we have to wait for him to be seen despite raising concerns after his 1st birthday. I feel that 1.5 years later is a long time to be without seeing a pediatrician. We have tried to phone the pediatrician a few times for advise for our son meantime as we keep being told that earlier intervention is best but we are struggling to ever get a response for them.

readBy.name: St. Andrews University ScotGEM Medical Students

author: mumby84
title: First baby scan
body:
We visited Croydon hospital for our first pregnancy scan.  
Sadly our experience was ruined by a rude interaction with a receptionist and a nurse whos' service was poor. They wasn't friendly, no explanations and almost made us feel like we shouldn't be there!  
For us it was supposed to be a magical day but we were rushed in although we arrive early, no conversation, no explanation as to what's happening in the scan. An image pretty much thrown at us and no goodbye!  
It was terrible service.  
My partner had to wait outside with the other men until called, in a tiny area, huddled together.... not exactly covid safe. He was then treated like he wasn't even involved in the scan, such a shame.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

author: lioneh59
title: Complaints procedure
body: My dad submitted a complaint in 2019, then passed away in early 2020 before any response was provided to this. I took this on on his behalf and had a very upsetting meeting in Sept 2020 but had hoped to get some resolution for this following the meeting. I have heard nothing since. 5 months later with no update, no response or minutes from the meeting, not even a phone call or email to advise of the progress. Feel so distressed that this is still ongoing and once again care and communication severely lacking. I have had to try and chase this up to be told the minutes of the meeting have yet to be authorised for release.

author: magpiepe38
title: A quite successful venture
body:
Because of the onset of coronavirus I wasn't able to share the health and care services of St Marys Hospice.  
However I did partake of a 5 week zoom session with the staff and other patients which I found most enlightening. I must say I found the staff very friendly and helpful and I think the venture was quite successful.  
Whether it could replace hands on face to face I don't know  
But doing it from the comfort of your own home was beneficial.

author: centauruspx35
title: Really helped
body: Been in addiction for a lot of my life getting in touch with S. T. A. R. S. really helped giving me the tools to cope and move forward. I'm still in contact with local drop in centres

author: coordinationcp76
title: Really cool key worker
body:
Key worker really cool  
Could have done with a little more support

author: courageke69
title: In a more positive place
body:
Not long out of jail. Part of my condition's was to engage with S.T.A.R.S. But soon realised it was a really positive move.  
Life has turned for the better, and in a more positive place in life.

author: delphinusxx67
title: One-to-one phone calls
body: Brilliant, as soon as I engaged, the help was given. Handouts, one-to-one phone calls. Really helpful

title: Great service
body: In my opinion I think the GP is very successful and the staff are very helpful and kind. The doctors are well experienced and explain to me clearly what my problem is and what the next steps are.

title: Review
body: I have been with this GP for a while, it is a good gp. The receptionist are usually well organised and the doctors are good.

author: Red2021
title: Breast & Endocrine Clinic
body:
I had an appointment today for a routine mammogram. My radiographer, Sarah (I think) was lovely, amiable and chatty while efficiently manoeuvring things into place. The appointment flew by, but I didn't feel rushed at any point. Didn't quite make it in and out in time to beat the first 15 minutes parking, but it was close :-)  
Unit is really efficient & confidence inspiring on the whole - I've been attending for several years now, never have to wait around past appointment time, information is freely offered and everything is explained. A really good service.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: coordinationtw44
title: Efficient and friendly all the way
body:
It can sometimes be nerve-racking trying to get to the right place in a large hospital - not so at the Ulster, Arrows and signs everywhere, and squads of friendly, helpful people directing operations.  
Efficient and (mostly) friendly all the way, no delays, in fact, I hardly got time to fill in my form!  
Well done, all of you

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: tangojn83
title: Given me hope
body: Hoping to move on and feel well. S. T. A. R. S have given me and hope to get my life back on track.

author: februaryjb98
title: I need to better myself
body: Finding it hard to stop drinking. Reached out as if it was affecting my life in all the wrong places, my family have been through a lot also. And I realised I need to better myself in order to be able to be there for my family

author: branfn54
title: Cracking on
body: Really nice and friendly. All the staff I spoke to were on point. Not used since - cracking on with my life.

author: jivekg83
title: Vaccine  for covid 19
body: Very well managed, pleasant, helpful staff I felt completely safe and at ease.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Oaktree Clinic rTMS Treatment
body: I recently used the Oaktree Clinic services as I had been experiencing severe feelings of numbness which I believed to be depression and anxiety based. I had a lot of nerves about receiving treatment and was concerned that I would be judged for my symptoms, however as soon as i entered the clinic I was immediately put at ease. The receptionist was very kind and made me feel at home, and the service had a very warm feeling to it. I was attending the clinic to receive rTMS treatment for which my Doctor at the Clinic prescribed and was well laid out to me before undertaking the treatment. When i arrived for my first few rTMS treatments the technician was very helpful and informed on any concerns that I had. He was able to ease my nerves about the treatment and I feel like he made the whole process much easier for me as he was the main person doing my treatments. During the treatments he stayed with me and made me feel reassured that everything was okay as well as giving me practical advice on how to get through the treatment. Since having my rTMS I have noticed a dramatic drop in my anxious and depressive symptoms and I am chosing to couple this with psychotherapy which I think will make me feel even better in the long run. I would like to thank all the Oaktree Clinic staff because I dont know what I would have been able to do without them!

title: Excellent care
body: I cannot fault the care I received yesterday. I have never been shown so much respect, kindness and understanding in a hospital before.

title: Well organised Covid vaccine service
body:
We are not registered to this practice (but to another in the group of 4)- but I just wanted to post a quick note to say how well my wife & I felt the AstraZennica vaccine shots were given yesterday (29/1/21). Yes, there were a lot a patients and so there was an element of a conveyor belt - but that is exactly what is required in order to get as many people innoculated (and thus imminently protected) as quickly as possible. Certainly the army of volunteers really helped - please pass that back if you can.
So thanks again to all involved - we are so pleased to have been "done"!

title: Perfect particularly in these trying times
body: I was welcomed by the admitting nurse who was friendly, helpful and efficient. The colonoscopy team introduced themselves, explained what was going to happen and were thoughtful and caring throughout my procedure. The nurses in the aftercare ward were exemplary. They recognised I was having problems once dressed and having tea, and were quick to deal with it. It is good to know that they are keeping an eye on you. Their care was something that will stick with me for some time.I cannot speak highly enough of the colonoscopy team and can only say they all deserve a 🌟

readBy.name: University Hospitals Dorset NHS Foundation Trust

title: Brilliant - Always Goes Above and Beyond
body:
They’ve helped so much over this past year and the new Practice Manager in particular has been absolutely amazing, especially as I’ve been trying to care for my elderly grandfather. Helping look after someone with a lot of underlying health conditions is quite complicated. The Practice Manager been absolutely fantastic in helping me sort out referrals and making sure appointments are arranged with the same GP each time (to improve continuity of care). Also needed some medical letters sorted on a few instances and have always received a call back within the hour. We’re in one of the worst hit boroughs’ in London throughout the covid-pandemic – our local hospital Northwick Park was actually the first in the country to declare a critical incident running out of beds during the first wave – so we’ve had to really rely on our GP Practice these last 12 months.

I note some of the less positive reviews are from a year or two ago before the new Practice Manager took over, so I’d advise reading them with caution. All I can say is that is that I’ve only experienced complete and upmost professionalism from her. Always goes above and beyond - there was one time when we needed some medications and we got a call back within about 20 minutes saying a prescription had already been sent to the pharmacy downstairs and was ready to collect.

title: Excellent all round service
body: As a carer I took a relative to the practice and cannot praise highly enough the standard of care and professionalism shown. Over recent weeks I have had interaction with reception staff, district nurse and doctors and everyone has been polite and very helpful no matter how trivial my concerns might be.

author: Annie J
title: Visit to urgent care dept
body:
I was referred to the urgent care centre following a cat bite which had become red and inflamed.  
I work in the NHS. I was booked in & looked after very well in the emergency department where triage staff nurse Kim arranged the appointment at urgent care.  
My appointment was within an hour.  
I was seen by a nurse practitioner, Tracey took my history, examined my arm and a blood sample to check my Tetanus status.  
Fortunately I don’t require an anti-tetanus booster and she arranged for a course of antibiotics.  
I cannot thank all involved in my care and treatment enough for the efficient and professional care I received, particularly in these challenging times.  
I am feeling so much better as a result and my arm is healing well.

readBy.name: St. Andrews University ScotGEM Medical Students

title: Great Service
body: Went for Vaccine outstanding service extremely friendly and well organised fast and efficient very happy

title: Tremendous care of patients
body: All my concerns regarding the virus were answered with clarity and I am continually impressed by the patient staff at EPS reception. My respect and admiration for all the doctors and nurses working so hard to help us get through this virus.

title: Great practice
body: I have been a patient of this practice for many years, and have found the service unfailingly helpful, friendly, and medically excellent. I feel like writing this now because the doctors and support staff have been under huge pressure due to the pandemic, but have nevertheless maintained an excellent service. The reception staff are always extremely courteous and efficient, and the doctors always listen, so you never feel rushed. The new premises are bright and welcoming - so, all in all, despite its not being one of the largest practices in the area, it consistently punches above its weight.

title: Excellent service
body: I was brought to the hospital after a fall on ice when I broke my wrist. I was x rayed and referred to Salisbury hospital very quickly. All staff were kind and professional and provided excellent care and support.

readBy.name: Dorset HealthCare University NHS Foundation Trust

title: Very professional practice
body: I've been with Sternhall Lane Surgery for two years, and have received consistently high quality of care. The people in reception and dealing with telephone enquiries are always courteous, helpful, and go beyond the strictly necessary to help out. I am moving and will have to leave the surgery, and am very sorry to do so.

title: A superb practice
body: The doctors know what they are talking about and recognised that I had  health condition in less than two appointments, whereas that past experience I had prior, I had been relentlessly ignored. The accessibility of the GPs and their knowledge of your medical history is also astounding when considering their eye watering portfolio, which covers the Headingly, Kirkstall and Bramley region. In addition to the support that I have received from the GPS, the nurses are always a welcoming presence in the surgery. All in all, a welcoming practice.

title: Efficient Service
body: Consultation for fatty liver. Blood tests, scans etc all done promptly in spite of covid and results of tests explained clearly and concisely. Friendly staff at reception and throughout the hospital. Many thanks to all at Hull Royal.

readBy.name: Hull University Teaching Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Vaccine injection
body: it was a bitterly cold evening, the queue for the COVID vaccine was outside in the street, but the helpful staff had us inside and ready for our jab as swiftly as they could. The medical staff was helpful polite and very professional and it was very well organised with volunteers to make sure you knew exactly where to stand etc. 10/10 if I had to score it, well done WH Surgery.

title: FRIENDLY  AND COMFORTABLE
body:
I've been treated by staff at Chelsfield Surgery for twenty years now  and always with kindness and efficiency.  I never find it daunting to visit Chelsfield Surgery because I feel confident that all staff are efficient in their various rolls. Reception staff put up with my humour which is a tonic in itself. Having been to receive my Corona Jab on Tuesday last, I returned home feeling the need to write about it. 
                                    I had the jab this afternoon, so now I'm virus free.
                                    They say it gives protection from a serious malady.
                                    The side effects are minimal and nothing to be feared.
                                    You may feel sick or dizzy and perhaps a little wiered.
                                    But, the benefit of immunity is sure to be applauded.
                                    My thanks to those at Chelsfield are here in rhyme recorded.

title: great home
body: staff always smiling and very friendly. quite home with lovely gardens with 2 rose beds and loads of wildlife.

title: Covid vaccination
body: I had my first Covid-19 vaccination yesterday: everything was first class. Staff were all friendly and helpful, from the car parking staff to the nurses and volunteers. Thank you to all of you for your dedication and professionalism.

title: Couldn’t have had better care and treatment.
body: I got put on ward one and every single person who had seen me/dealt with me made me feel welcome at ease and most importantly safe! I went for surgery the following day and even the after care was second to none. I couldn’t thank them enough and I don’t have one fault. Thank you so much. Also would like to add the a and e team were a great help and the surgeons too!! Hats off to them all❤️❤️

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Morecambe Bay NHS Foundation Trust

title: Well organised, accessible, fantastic staff
body: Each time I've visited the practise staff have been really accomodating, friendly and professional.  I was really impressed with the way information re: results of diabetes testing is presented.  It was presented in a way that it actually makes sense for the first time and actually made me take stock of the results rather than just seeming like numbers on a page.  Things like this make such a difference!  I feel like they have some very good systems in place and it is well organised even in difficult times like now!

title: Reception staff
body: I've  recently changed Dr's to be on Dr Jalota and Dr Dubb books. The reception staff are extremely helpful and very helpful indeed. They all have made me feel very welcome indeed.

title: 5Star Treatment
body: Both my husband and myself have had our vaccinations. We had to express our heartfelt thanks to all the staff and volunteers who guided us safely. From the wonderful people on the gate advising us where to park, to all the nurses, doctors and staff that administered the jab, it was a wonderful experience. We couldn’t get over how pleasant everyone was, it was friendly and relaxed and we were thanked for coming in. It was a 5 star experience.

title: what wonderful staff
body:
The medical team who assessed and managed me were without exception polite and understanding as I was very concerned regarding my symptoms.  I had speedy and thorough treatment, the consultant came and advised me the course of the investigations within a few minutes of entering the ward, and clearly outlined all of the options and the rationale for treatment.
Without exception and this includes the wonderful nursing staff who demonstreated exceptional nursing and communication skilss and could not do enough to make my admission comfortable, despite the fact that other patients required greater assistance.    The tea lady who made me extra drinks, the therapists who came to see me all of who explained their role with clarity and great care. The porters who took me to a range of different scans and investigations.  The technicians and radiologists and I met several of these members of staff during the course of my time in hospital.  
Every body gave excellent care and service and treated me as a person not a patient, every body did their job with efficiency but also 'went the extra mile'. Also I enjoyed the food it was well cooked and well presented.  In all, all of these staff made what was to me a traumatic episode much less stressful.

title: Amazing nurse
body: I had to go in for blood test and the nurse “Olivara- Orlivia “ apologises I can’t remember right. Was just amazing ! Really reassuring and so good ,We were done in 1 min and it was so quick and pain free !

title: Efficient annual review.
body: I was invited to wait in my car and a pager was brought to the door. This worked beautifully and I was dealt with in a cheerful and friendly way. One of my blood readings was low and I received a phone call to tell me within 24 hours. A retest was arranged in the same call. This went in the same way except they now have a hatch in the wall to hand out the pager. Again all cheerful and friendly.  Full marks!

title: Covid vaccination
body: Speedy, efficient, friendly. No discomfort with the injection. I experienced mild flu symptoms after 12 hours which lasted for one day. Your questionnaire is not suited to a Covid vaccination: all the contact was managed by yourselves

title: Very helpful
body: Due to not  needing  an item from my repeat prescription, I was unsure if I could order it, but the young lady on the phone confirmed  it was and ordered  it for me, usually  anything extra I need I  always go through the proper channels  this young lady was extremely  helpful.

title: Well organised
body: I attended for my covid vaccination and was so impressed with how well organised it was, professional and friendly. Please express my thanks to your team.

title: Excellent , very well organised
body:
Received a text to make an appointment for vaccination, made the appointment straight away and received a confirmation then a reminder. On the morning of the vaccination all the members of staff were very friendly . I cannot fault the organisation , excellent.
A VERY BIG THANK YOU TO ALL OF YOU.

title: Excellent!
body:
We had our covid jabs on Friday 12th and were very impressed with the excellent organisation! NHS at it's very best!
So many cheerful and friendly volunteers on an extremely cold day and they did a great job. Well done everyone.

title: Brilliant practice
body: Excellent and very safe conditions for my Covid vaccination in January. I have online access to book appointments and always have prompt very helpful advice. Thank you everyone.

title: Smooth Process
body: From initial contact to the actual injection the whole process went extremely smoothly. Anyone thinking about not having the jab needs to think again.

title: Wonderful Friendly Practice
body:
I just wanted to say how wonderful the team have been at LHGP - I have always been nervous when moving GP's after being 'spoilt' really with my practice in my small village at home (having doctors who have known myself and my family all my life). But after falling ill with an infection last year during the lockdown I registered with LHGP. I've been to a few GP's from uni and moving around London who I haven't always enjoyed seeing, but I can safely say that every single interaction I have had at LHGP has been so warm, polite, friendly and professional: all the way from the receptionists to the nurses and doctors, they've all been wonderful. 

They seem to have taken all COVID-19 secure changes during the pandemic in their stride, or at least don't make any stress that may going on behind the scenes of organising everything visible at all. 

I know that part of any NHS staff's role is to be understanding, polite and kind in their bedside manner, but LHGP just seem to go above and beyond that in every way that they have dealt with myself personally, and in the way that I have heard them speak to other patients in the waiting room etc. 

I feel very lucky to have them as my local practice, and thought it was important to share this. It's very easy to criticise at the moment, tensions are high and people seem to want to place blame where possible, but I don't think I could find fault with the wonderful team at LHGP even if I tried. They are really an asset to the NHS.

title: Excellent care
body: I was seen urgently by a GP who treated me with kindness and thoroughness. Excellent, reassuring care.

title: covid injection 1
body: Good  from start to finish. Excellent notification process. staff warm and efficient . Processed with minimum fuss and maximum efficiency

title: Covid vaccination
body: So pleased to receive a telephone call to invite me for my covid vaccination .Appointment provided for same day. Very quick and organised process . Super helpful staff - excellent all round

title: Great practice!
body: The nurse was very friendly and made me very comfortable as naturally I’m a nervous person. Not a long waiting time, and I received a text while waiting outside to let me know the doctor was on her way out, great service!

title: COVID vaccination
body: Extremely well organised vaccination session at Bridge health Centre on Saturday, 13 February 2021. Felt very safe and all staff were excellent.

title: Great service
body: I had persistent symptoms of infection on Friday evening and was really anxious about things getting worse by Monday. There was also the added anxiety about health coming from the lockdown and isolation. I called 111 North West and they were really helpful. They called me back within 2 hours and scheduled an appointment with a GP. Thank you!

title: Lifesaving Service
body: I attended with my son to see a doctor for a psychiatric assessment. I found everything extremely pleasant from the moment I walked into reception and took a seat. The assessment conducted by the doctor was extremely thorough and she made reference to NICE guidelines a few times when describing treatment and the reasons for their recommendation. Unfortunately I am not fluent with my spoken English and was pleasantly surprised that I was able to converse with the doctor in Hindi at times. I have no hesitation in recommending this medical establishment to others.

title: Great experience
body: I attended the surgery today for my Covid-19 vaccination and can give nothing but praise for the way it was organised. Highly efficient and I felt very safe. The staff were also friendly and professional and gave me all the information I needed while keeping the appointment as short as possible, which is what was promised. Many thanks to all of you.

title: Good Practice
body: Very efficient.friendly staff.Appointment time within minutes of arrival. Information given by staff through leaflets and face to face safely distancing.I felt very comfortable and reassured throughout my experience.

title: Covid vaccination
body: Very well organised from making the appointment to completing the vaccination. The staff were so professional and made you feel safe.

title: Excellent ultrasound team
body: I was referred by my GP for an ultrasound and this was the nearest place handling them. I went twice and its such a great efficient clean space and everybody very professional and helpful. Today I also got to witness their vaccination efforts, it looked brilliant. I was worried that my appointment was maybe going to be cancelled but no, all took place super punctual. Thank you!

title: Great receptionist on the phone
body:
This is a great practice with well organised, hardworking staff.
Very professional, friendly and helpful service from the receptionist this morning.Clear help and advice about appointments.
Thank you.
Thank you all.Stay safe.

title: Awesome service
body:
Phoned in at 0800 on the dot to speak to a GP about a massive concern. 
Within 10 minutes I’d had a call back from a lovely GP who booked me in to see him face to face within a couple of hours. 
Very streamlined process - definitely put my mind at ease as much as they can! 

Awesome!

title: Wonderful service in difficult times
body: Swift and very thorough response to online consultation. Filled in the form on Saturday, problem dealt with on Monday morning. Thank you!

title: Friendly and well organised.
body: I came for my covid jab after a friendly phone call inviting me down to the surgery the next morning.  I was extremely impressed by how efficient and well organised everything was.

title: The world's best medical center #1
body: This practice is terrific. All physicians combines expertise and a willingness to listen and discuss. Also, the staff is very friendly and professional. I’ve never had to wait more than a few minutes when I arrive on time for an appointment.They ensured I had a smooth prep, surgery, and follow-up. I am so glad we chose these folks  and would highly recommend to anyone.It’s rare to find a physicians MD's  that combines such personal touches and care for a patient as a person with outstanding quality of medical care.  We will definitely be back and would recommend the medical center and support staff!

title: Excellent practice
body: They are always very helpful and easy to talk to, they also help a lot with prescriptions, there online services are also very easy to use and even if your not sure they ether talk you through what to do or text you instructions very very helpful team thank you

title: Superb, attentive practice
body: Emailed in to reach out to my GP about some health concerns, within a day he was on the phone and talked things through with me for almost 25 minutes. Practically unheard of but this is the amazing level of care provided at the Emsworth practice.

title: Covid jab
body: Very efficient and friendly people at the surgery. I had my jab with a nurse who was lovely and re-assuring and professional.

title: Covid vaccination
body: My wife and I received our vaccinations on separate days last week at the Glenside surgery. We were very impressed with the service as both sessions were well organised and very efficient. The staff were very helpful and there was ample car parking. Nobody should be worried about the vaccines.

title: Exceptional service.
body: I’m 69 and was hoping my age group would be vaccinated perhaps by end of February. However,  I was contacted by the surgery on 10 Feb asking if I would like to go on a waiting list for any cancellations presumably by those in the 70 and over groups. I said Yes. The following day 11 Feb I was contacted and offered an appointment the following day 12 Feb which I obviously accepted. When I arrived I was amazed by the number of people outside and inside the surgery. Everything appeared to be running perfectly with those waiting for their jab and those having had it constantly entering and leaving the surgery. All the staff were good humoured, extremely pleasant and helpful in every way. From arrival at the surgery to leaving having had my jab and in possession of my vaccination card took no more than 10 minutes. Incredible when there were so many people there. The whole process was in my view astonishingly smooth and quite humbling to see the staff working so hard for us all in what must be difficult circumstances for them all. They are all a credit to their practice and the NHS. Thank you to all those involved.

title: Great Practice
body: I have now received my Covid 10 vaccination.   As always... the service and attention to patient safety was exceptional.  Thank you to all the staff and volunteers at Nettlebed Surgery for their commitment.

author: Tomysoup1
title: Great service, above and beyond
body:
I was recently in hospital with covid + pneumonia. At the start I was struggling with taste and appetite and couldn’t face any food despite wanting to eat. It was only due to Sharon who spent extra time suggesting different foods and even finding certain foods that I could eat to start me off. Just a basic soup instead of the ‘normal’ style foods menu gave me a meal instead of nothing. I can’t thank her or praise her enough for this.  
This is also on top of all the great care etc from all the other nursing teams to actually fight the covid + pneumonia I was in for.  
Thanks and respect to all of them.  
I would like Sharon to be nominated for a G.E.M award.

author: Great Appreciation
title: Ambulance service
body:
I was outstandingly cared for by the ambulance crew and PRUH A&E last Wednesday and Thursday, discharged last night.  
I was in a lot of pain with an extremely sore catheter that was tugging. When the ambulance crew Jane and Hannah arrived the assessment was completed so quickly. Jane immediately gave me more relief with an extra strap. I was in a very High Activation Positive Moodstate and having lots of flashbacks because of Complex PTSD which I have had untreated for 58 years but with Jane’s 20 years of paramedic experience she soon had a full understanding of the seriousness of my condition. I was also on antibiotics for my bladder and testicles. After checking blood pressure, etc., and putting all the information into an automated system Hannah set off without a blue light. That would have traumatised me further as I had been taken as an emergency in ambulances many times in very traumatic circumstances. A blue light would have precipitated very severe flashbacks so instead Jane and I had a very good laugh which brought my endorphins out and eased my emotional pain. When I arrived at the PRUH I was whisked into a cubicle and handed over to more OUTSTANDING Care, Compassion, Commitment, Competence, Communication and possibly above all Courage in the front Line of the battle against Covid.  
THANKS 🤩 so much Jane and Hannah.  
I will write more tomorrow with details of the continued Outstanding treatment in casualty from everybody including and especially Tola who was working as part of a very efficient A&E team. Fantastic, THANKS 🤩 every single one of you.

title: Friendly and very efficient
body: We found all the volunteers, right through to the professional medical staff very friendly and efficient. We arrived ten minutes early and  were dealt with straight away returning to our car within 10 minutes! THANK YOU

title: Brilliant - Always Goes Above and Beyond
body:
They’ve helped so much over this past year and the new Assistant Practice Manager in particular has been absolutely amazing, especially as I’ve been trying to care for my elderly grandfather. Helping look after someone with a lot of underlying health conditions is quite complicated. The Assistant Practice Manager been absolutely fantastic in helping me sort out referrals and making sure appointments are arranged with the same GP each time (to improve continuity of care). Also needed some medical letters sorted on a few instances and have always received a call back within the hour. We’re in one of the worst hit boroughs’ in London throughout the covid-pandemic – our local hospital Northwick Park was actually the first in the country to declare a critical incident running out of beds during the first wave – so we’ve had to really rely on our GP Practice these last 12 months.

I note some of the less positive reviews are from a year or two ago before the new Assistant Practice Manager took over, so I’d advise reading them with caution. All I can say is that is that I’ve only experienced complete and upmost professionalism from her. Always goes above and beyond - there was one time when we needed some medications and we got a call back within about 20 minutes saying a prescription had already been sent to the pharmacy downstairs and was ready to collect.

readBy.name: St. Andrews University ScotGEM Medical Students

title: Awful receptionists
body:
The way the staff who answer the telephone and speak to patients is awful. No amount of training can fix the bad attitudes that are plain to hear when you you call this surgery.
If this was a private business it would not be operating with this level of poor customer care on the telephone.
Do not sign up to this surgery as you will receive the same humiliation and poor service from receptionists who are not doctors. If you manage to get an appointment with a doctor they are terrific.

title: Covid 19 vaccination
body: I went for my vaccination on Saturday morning after a phone call two days earlier, and everything was very well organised and efficient. Having arrived on time I was shown straight in and was out again in a few minutes. Then I waited for 10 minutes in the heated marquee outside where there were volunteers supervising and cleaning the chairs after each use. Everyone on duty was very pleasant and I would recommend the service highly.

title: Amazing practice!
body:
Hello 
I want to say a big thank you to everyone at Lakeside Surgery.
I had my Covid Vaccine this morning and felt a bit nervous and unsure of where to go as I usually attend the Forest Gate surgery.
However, from the moment I arrived I felt confident that all would be good.  The signposting and directions were very clear and once inside the building I was directed by the warm friendly staff.  I was then scooped up by the nursing staff who were so lovely and cheerful.  Amazing is the only way to describe all concerned!  
In the short time I was there (proof of their efficiency) I felt welcome and well cared for by everyone I met.
Thank you, thank you, thank you!
Given the pressure on the NHS at this time it really was nothing short of a top professional service by warm friendly and caring staff. Well done to all concerned. 👏

title: Worst practice I've been to
body: They have little organisation and continuously mess up the repeat prescriptions for myself as well as both my parents. Not to mention the rudeness of the reception staff.

title: Rude Receptionists - Appalling Attitude
body: Having been given a life changing diagnosis from a consultant referral, I was told to contact my GP immediately for urgent medication which my GP was to prescribe. The receptionist would not let me talk to my GP or initiate a prescription over the phone. I had to find a local pharmacy to call instead of me and initiate it. This was all new to me having never needed any medication previously. The receptionist said "we only deal with Macmillan now, you're not important", startled and taken aback, I replied "I need life saving heart medication, isn't that important?", she said "No" and put the phone down! I will be taking this further once we're out of this Covid drama.

title: Brilliant Service
body: All staff are very kind and helpful from the receptionists, nurses and doctors. Thank you so much for all you do, I’m so pleased I am at this surgery. Quick and efficient with appointments and follow up appointments too.

title: Fabulous experience
body:
I visited the surgery earlier this month. The staff were pleasant, efficient and friendly. 
Covid regulations were followed correctly and I had an overall very positive experience. Would definitely recommend to new patients. 
Excellent service.

title: Needs better online systems
body:
- Registration and booking appointments online is confusing and missing features. For example you cannot book nurse appointments online, you have to call which means you will be waiting on hold for a long time. 
- Whenever I ran into problems I found the staff were not particularly polite and made me feel stupid for not knowing how they operate (even though none of that info is shown online). 
I can only guess they are understaffed and under pressure from COVID 
- Not clear when prescriptions are ready to be picked up and I was told contradictory times by the GP and the staff that work there. Would be nice to be notified about this online

title: Exceptional service
body: Very embarrassing problem. Was put at ease. Very kind and thorough GP. Extremely Professional. Ask my GP is a very convenient way of seeking help. My dealings with the Practice have always been dealt with great efficiency, professionalism and kindness. Thank you.

title: Worst surgery
body: It don’t matter what time you ring them they never answer the phone been the phone for an hour still no one answered this is the only surgery that never answers the phone trying to say their phone lines are always busy which is unbelievable

title: Best Practice I’ve Ever Been At
body: This practice has a lovely team with friendly staff that seriously care about you and look after you well. It is easy to get in touch with the admin team. Online consultations are easy and are always responded to in a timely manner. Appointment wait times are extremely short and I’ve never had to wait more than a couple of days. Thank you to all of the team at Avenue Medical Practice for delivering outstanding care.

readBy.name: Meadowgreen Health Centre & The Avenue Medical Practice

title: VERY SATISFIED WITH TREATMENT ALLOTTED
body: Having been taken to Darenth by ambulance (2 lovely lady paramedics) with blue lights flashing and siren on, arrived at A&E late night and was seen immediately by staff and consultant.  Was diagnosed quickly and treated accordingly, being monitored by consultant at all times.  Despite all the varying nationalities of staff on duty, everyone was efficient and kind, despite being busy.  When I was deemed fit enough to go home, which was early hours of the morning, because I couldn't raise anyone to collect me to take me home I was found a place in the day ward where, once again, I was treated with care and kindness.  I was grateful for the tea and biscuits (not having eaten since lunch time the previous day).  I left the hospital at 0900 with a detailed resume of my experience and appropriate medication.  I have to say that this hospital has changed for the better remarkably since my mother and sister were both there on their death beds in 2001 and 2014.

author: Tks
title: Domicilary Care Team
body: We have a lot of snow today and roads and footpaths very slippery and dangerous. Despite this my mum's wonderful carer Louise still made it to my mum house this morning.. such a brilliant team of staff that our health service has in our community.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Covid Vaccine
body: Everyone friendly and so well organised incredibly impressed with the whole operation of moving people safely and the ease of the whole experience

title: Amazing Practice
body: All reception staff, nursing staff and GP's do an amazing job providing care and support. I would like to thank them all for working so hard.

title: Safe hands
body: As an MS sufferer I have many issues but each issue has been treated with respect and proactive help. I cannot thank the team enough for all they have done for me. I always feel listened to and not judged or patronised. Thank you.

title: very efficient
body: first visit for vaccine all the staff from the car park attendants to all those indoors provided a fast and efficient service working fast to provide a quick turnaround. Brilliant very well done to all concerned thanks jim

title: First visit to see a nurse
body: On my first visit to this surgery to see s nurse I felt very unwelcome as she was quite rude and off putting. This hasn’t done much for my confidence.

title: Covid Care
body:
I was an in-patient for 8 days with covid pneumonia - this included a spell on high dependency ward before being stepped down to a shared ward with other Covid cases. I benefited from excellent nursing care which was flexible, compassionate and made me feel safe and looked after even though the overall experience of being ill was frightening.
I will always be grateful to the nursing staff, and others for their wonderful professional care, cheerfulness and help in getting better.
